could be either a global learner or a sequential learner and if you're a global learner you serve you absorb
large jumps of material and and you do it almost randomly and then you don't
really understand the details and suddenly you see the big picture of everything but if you're a sequential
learner you like to take in little bits of information if you shown the big picture first you do not want to see it

details i'm not so interested in they'll come whenever I need them but the big picture is very important for me so
that's why when I was teaching I would always try to make the big picture first and then give all the details later on because I thought they were not as
